column4: I am having such a hard time getting my domain name to forward to the proper folder. I have created the necessary config files in sites-available and sites-enabled and restarted apache but my domain name still points to the www folder instead of www/mydomainname/. Any suggestions?
No. The tutorials don't mention that.
Since version 2 httpd.conf is deprecated. Use instead /etc/apache2/apache2.conf or /etc/apache2/sites-enabled/000-default
I can't find anything in apache2.conf that needs to be changed. Can you point me in the right direction?
Please say again what it is you wish to configure/do, I missed it previously
I want to set up virtual hosts. My domain name resolves to the IP Address of my server but in the browser I just get /var/www instead of /var/www/mydomainname.
I have created the necessary config files in sites-available and sites-enabled but it is not working still.
Yes and there were no errors.
I don't understand what you mean by seeing /var/www in the browser. If you point a web browser to the ip/name you should see all BELOW that directory

Yes but I am trying to set it up so that domainone.com goes to one folder and domaintwo.com goes to another. They all go to /var/www instead of them each going to /var/www/domainone and /var/www/domaintwo
If you have an alias/virtual host entry in 000-default for example, there will not be a directory which is named /var/www/virtualname unless the alias/virtualhost dir is ALSO in /var/www
I am trying so hard to understand that sentence but it went over my head.
What did you put for DocumentRoot    when you made alterations to the 000-default or apache2.conf file?
I searched for DocumentRoot in apache2.conf and found nothing.

Perhaps take a look at the virtual host entry the person here made, it's the 7th greyish panel down the page, and compare it with whatever you put:  http://www.mjmwired.net/resources/mjm-apache-virtual-sites.html
